security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation generator that provides workflow instructions for preparing PR descriptions. The static scanner flagged 56 issues, but ALL findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misinterpreted SHA256 cryptographic hashes as 'weak cryptographic algorithms,' standard git commands as 'shell execution threats,' and metadata URLs as 'network indicators.' The skill contains only documentation markdown with no actual code, no network calls, no data exfiltration, and no malicious functionality.

content.value_statement: Writing clear PR descriptions takes time and consistency. This skill automatically gathers git context, analyzes changes, and generates standardized PR descriptions following conventional commit formats.
actual_capabilities: Gathers git context including status, branch, commits, and file changes
Analyzes modified components and their purpose
Generates PR descriptions using standardized templates
Suggests PR titles following conventional commit formats
limitations: Does not push code or create PRs directly
Requires git repository with clean working state
Does not validate tests or linting automatically

use_cases.title: Streamline PR workflow
use_cases.description: Generate consistent, professional PR descriptions without memorizing templates or running git commands manually

use_cases.title: Enforce documentation standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team PRs include standardized summaries, change lists, and impact assessments

use_cases.title: Improve contribution quality
use_cases.description: Help contributors write clear PR descriptions that make code reviews faster and more effective

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR request
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare the PR for this branch. Include a summary, changes, impact, and testing notes.

prompt_templates.title: Feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR description for this feature branch. What components changed and what benefits does this provide?

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR describing this bug fix. Include what was broken, what changed, and how it was tested.

prompt_templates.title: Complex PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive PR description. Analyze all changes, identify breaking impacts, and suggest testing requirements.

output_examples.input: Prepare the PR for this feature branch
output: Suggested Title: feat: add user authentication with OAuth2
## Summary
Add OAuth2 authentication supporting Google and GitHub providers.
## Changes
- auth/oauth.py: OAuth2 client with token refresh
- api/routes/auth.py: Login, logout, callback endpoints
- models/user.py: User model with OAuth fields
## Impact
- Users can sign in with Google or GitHub
- Secure session management with httponly cookies
- No breaking changes

output_examples.input: Prepare a PR for this bug fix
output: Suggested Title: fix: resolve null pointer in user lookup
## Summary
Fixed null pointer exception when looking up users that do not exist in the database.
## Changes
- services/user.py: Added null check before accessing user properties
- tests/user_test.py: Added test cases for missing user scenarios
## Impact
- Prevents crashes on invalid user lookups
- Graceful error handling for missing users
- No breaking changes to existing functionality

output_examples.input: Create a PR description for the documentation updates
output: Suggested Title: docs: update API documentation with new endpoints
## Summary
Updated API documentation to include new authentication endpoints and rate limiting information.
## Changes
- docs/api.md: Added new endpoint documentation
- docs/auth.md: Updated authentication flow diagrams
## Impact
- Improved developer experience
- No code changes, only documentation

best_practices: Run the skill after completing changes but before pushing to ensure clean git status
Review the generated description and add any context-specific details
Use the conventional commit format for PR titles to maintain consistency
anti_patterns: Using the skill with uncommitted changes that are not part of the PR
Copying the output without reviewing for accuracy
Skipping the testing checklist items before creating the PR

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires access to run git commands in your repository.

faq.question: What git commands are executed?
faq.answer: The skill runs git status, git log, and git diff to gather context about changes between your branch and the base branch.

faq.question: Can I customize the PR template?
faq.answer: The template in the skill is a starting point. You can modify it for your project or request changes to the skill template.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs locally and only reads your git repository. No data is transmitted to external services.

faq.question: What if git commands fail?
faq.answer: Ensure you are in a git repository with changes to commit. The skill needs a clean working state or tracked changes.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub PR templates?
faq.answer: GitHub PR templates are static files. This skill dynamically generates descriptions based on your actual code changes.
